id: Keyboard and mouse controls finally hit Xbox One this week
paragraph:
Front page layoutSite themeSign up or login to join the discussions!
Kyle Orland
    -  Nov 12, 2018 2:55 pm UTC
In addition to Fortnite and Warframe, which should receive the new control options this week, Microsoft said the following Xbox One games would receive mouse and keyboard support in November:Seven more titles will add mouse and keyboard support "in the future," according to Microsoft:Alongside the software support, Microsoft also announced a "designed for Xbox" line of keyboards that will include a dedicated Xbox button for system-level menu-hopping, as well as dynamic key-lighting features in games like X-Morph Defense and Warhammer Vermintide 2. Razer is the exclusive manufacturing partner announced for this program so far and promised a wireless, mechanical "designed for Xbox" keyboard that would "reinvent gaming on the couch" following an unveiling at CES in January.You must login or create an account to comment.Join the Ars Orbital Transmission mailing list to get weekly updates delivered to your inbox.
